html.question: What is HTML
html.answer:
Hypertext Markup Language
( HTML )
is the standard markup language for creating web pages.
It structures content using a system of elements and tags.

html.question: What is an Element
html.answer:
An element is a fundamental component in HTML, represented by a start tag, content, and an end tag.
Ex. <p> for paragraphs and <img> for images.

html.question: What is a Tag
html.answer:
Used to define elements in HTML,
tags consist of an opening <tag>, content, and a closing </tag>.

Ex. <h1> is the opening tag for a top-level heading.

html.question: What is an Attribute
html.answer:
Included in the opening tag,
Attribbutes provide additional information about HTML elements.

Ex. <a href="https://qarli.ca">

uses the href attribute.

html.question: What is a DOCTYPE Declaration
html.answer:
The DOCTYPE declaration specifies the HTML version being used by the document and helps browsers to render the page correctly.
Ex. <DOCTYPE html>

css.question: What is CSS
css.answer:
Cascading Style Sheet ( CSS )
is used to define styles for your web pages.

This includes the design, layout and variations in display for different devices and screen sizes.

css.question: What is a Selector
css.answer:
Selectors are patterns that are used to select and style HTML elements.

They define the target elements for applying styles.

Ex. .class or #id

css.question: What are Properties in css
css.answer:
CSS properties define the visual style of selected elements.

They include attributes like color, font-size, margin, padding, etc.

javascript.question: What is JavaScript
javascript.answer: JavaScript is an highlevel programming language.

javascript.question: What is a variable
javascript.answer:
Variables are containers for storing data values.

Ex. let x = 7

javascript.question: What are Data Types
javascript.answer:
JavaScript has several data types:
Number, String, Boolean, Object, and Array.

Ex. let name = 'Carla';
let age = 25;
let isStudent = true;
